parts.question_text: The curve \(D\) has equation \(y = (x+1)^3 - 4(x+1)\). State the coordinates of the points where the curve \(D\) meets the \(x\)-axis.
parts.solution_text:
Let \(y=0\).  Then \((x+1)^3 - 4(x+1) = 0\).
Factoring out \((x+1)\) gives \((x+1)((x+1)^2 - 4) = 0\).
This further simplifies to \((x+1)(x^2 + 2x + 1 - 4) = 0\), or \((x+1)(x^2 + 2x - 3) = 0\).
Factoring the quadratic gives \((x+1)(x+3)(x-1) = 0\).
Therefore, the x-coordinates of the points where the curve \(D\) meets the x-axis are \(x=-1\), \(x=-3\) and \(x=1\).
The corresponding y-coordinate is 0 in each case, so the coordinates are \((-3, 0)\), \((-1, 0)\), and \((1, 0)\).
